result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony B Bohanan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 3/28/17 at 3:00 pm.  If financial obligations are paid in full, hearing can be removed from the calendar.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action on all counts.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by DOC.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from DOC.

timeConds.notes:
Jail time applies to Ct. 1. STAYED as long as defendant is making $75 per month payments toward financial obligations. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.
3/28/17 - Court lifts stay on 30 days condition time.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Agent Ash re: his request to lift stay on 30 days condition time.

Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in court, in custody.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Olivia Glesner present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court reviews Agent Ash's memorandum reqarding DOC's request to lift stay on 30 days condition time. Agent Glesner updates court on a few more issues regarding defendant. Defendant does not object to court lifting stay on the jail time. Court signs order lifting stay on 30 days condition time. To commence forthwith.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony B Bohanan
Current: 828 Fremont Street, Algoma, WI 54201 United States  (Effective: 11-01-2016)
Prior: 1420 Iowa Place, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.  Probation review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense requests a status/plea-sentencing date in 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that matter is close to resolving.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests short adjournment to let defendant review State's offer and discovery material. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Gerbers requests a status about 30 days out. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with The Dollar Tree store or any one he knows that is employed there.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in court with attorney Eric Steven Maciolek who appears by phone.  Defendant Anthony B Bohanan in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Atty Maciolek indicates someone from his office will be representing defendant, asks court to set date for balance of AIA. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
